intro: Derris ferruginoides, commonly known as the African snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the Fabaceae family, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant contains various alkaloids, including curare-like compounds, which have been historically used in traditional medicine and as a poison for fishing. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forests and along riverbanks. Due to its toxic properties, it is important to handle the plant with care.
